generateNewBlogPost:
Please generate an engaging and informative blog post on a topic of your choice. The blog post should have the following structure:

1. An attention-grabbing title
2. An introduction section to hook the reader
3. 2-4 body sections with relevant information, insights, or arguments related to the topic
4. A conclusion section that summarizes the main points and leaves the reader with a final thought or call-to-action

Format the output as a JSON object with the following keys:

- `title` (for the blog post title)
- `content` (an object with a `blocks` array containing the blog post content structured as blocks)
- `status` (status of the blog post as 'publish')
- `categories` (use `"3"` for category)

Each block in the `blocks` array should have the following properties:

- `blockName` (the type of block, e.g. `core/heading`, `core/paragraph`)
- `attrs` (an object with attributes for the block, like heading level for `core/heading`)
- `innerBlocks` (an array for nested blocks, if applicable)
- `innerHTML` (the actual content of the block as HTML)

Here's an example structure:

```json
{
  "title": "Blog Post Title",
  "status": "draft",
  "categories": "3",
  "content": {
    "blocks": [
      {
        "blockName": "core/heading",
        "attrs": {
          "level": 2
        },
        "innerBlocks": [],
        "innerHTML": "Introduction"
      },
      {
        "blockName": "core/paragraph",
        "attrs": {},
        "innerBlocks": [],
        "innerHTML": "Introduction content..."
      },
      // ... more blocks for body and conclusion
    ]
  }
}

NOTE:
Always enclose the json output with ```json ```.
transformContentToBlocks:
I need your help to transform the following content into WordPress block grammar format. The goal is to identify different elements like headings, titles, images, paragraphs, lists, etc., and wrap them in appropriate HTML comments using the WordPress block grammar syntax.

Here's the content:

[Paste your content here]

To accomplish this task, please follow these steps:

1. Analyze the content and identify the different elements like headings (H1, H2, H3, etc.), titles, images, paragraphs, lists (ordered and unordered), blockquotes, and any other relevant elements.

2. For each element, wrap it with the corresponding WordPress block grammar HTML comment. For example:
   - Heading: <!-- wp:heading -->Heading Text<!-- /wp:heading -->
   - Paragraph: <!-- wp:paragraph -->Paragraph text.<!-- /wp:paragraph -->
   - Image: <!-- wp:image --><!-- /wp:image -->
   - List (unordered): <!-- wp:list --><!-- wp:list-item -->List item 1<!-- /wp:list-item --><!-- wp:list-item -->List item 2<!-- /wp:list-item --><!-- /wp:list -->
   - List (ordered): <!-- wp:list {"ordered":true} --><!-- wp:list-item -->List item 1<!-- /wp:list-item --><!-- wp:list-item -->List item 2<!-- /wp:list-item --><!-- /wp:list -->

3. Maintain the original structure and order of the elements in the transformed content.

4. If there are any additional details or attributes required for specific elements (e.g., image source, link URLs, etc.), include them within the corresponding block grammar comments.

5. Provide the transformed content with the WordPress block grammar markup as the output ENCLOSED WITHIN ```blocks ```.
